answers.answer: Keep trying :) took me a year and.a half to.concieve and I have pcos. 1-2 years isn't.considered abnormal. Eat healthily, exercise, and Try to relax and don't think.about it as trying. Take the stress off. if in a while you are still struggling you can see a doc for advice. Good luck :)
Took me 3 years ._. Jus go at it but dont think about it ..it will happen
when you are on your period wait until mid of it and then have sex and let him nutt in you may sound nasty but thats how i did it
It took us 2 yrs! He finally started trying more then me... holding my legs up afterwards ;)

@Balancedwifey that's cute and funny lol :)It took us about a year and a half also. we werent trying the first year but we weren't preventing than the half a year we were i was very stressed out because it wasn't happening so i was about to give up when we got pregnant. enjoy yourselves and don't make it a job and have fun!! :) good luck
Folic acid to prepare ur body! :-)
omg it took me an year and i honestly had s.e.x everyday no days missed and i used to lift my legs after we were done sometimes lol to keep the goody goody inside me

Relax and don't think about it. And have sex every other day because if he finishes inside you everyday his sperm count is a lot lower.  But the main thing is to relax and not stress over it.  It will happen when the time is right :)
Keep up with your cycle and get ovulation test. you normally emulate day 12-18 so try those days. every other day

Get drunk and have sex! Lol kidding but on a medical note, go out to dinner and have a few drinks to loosen up and not think about it, try to do this a couple times around your fertile period. Only have sex ever other to ever 2 days ( not everyday)  starting on the first day after your period and continue until the day before your period starts. Ive helped 3, of my friends conceive after trying for over a year

Having sex everyday actual builds a sperm barrier in your cervix that prevents other(live/active) sperm from penetrating an egg..also, just a tip not a midwifes tale, but if you are wanting a girl. Do not have sex the day of ovulation the day before to 2 days before you ovulate..in addition to conceiving ialso had 3 out of 3 positive results on gender :) i should be a fertility doctor!

My husband and i had tried and tried and tried. And come to find out i was making too much testoterone. She put me on metformin whicg is usually for diabetes patients. And it is also makes you more fertal so to speak. I was pregnant within a month of taking the medicine! :) good luck chicka!
